text: Razgrad () is a city in northeastern Bulgaria in the valley of the Beli Lom river. It is the capital of Razgrad Province. About 28,000 people live there. Razgrad was built on the ruins of the Ancient Roman town of Abritus. In 251, the town was the site of the Battle of Abritus, during which defeated by the Romans. The Razgrad clock tower was built in 1864. It has a football club called Ludogorets Razgrad. Category:Cities in Bulgaria
title: Razgrad
